item.description:
Join us for the first movie night for Buxton/Hollis/Gorham members and other "westerners" as we get to know our more local neighbors and build connections outside of Portland proper.

This film is from Australia and demonstrates how Josh Byrne creates a productive permaculture garden on a 1/4 acre suburban lot in Perth. "Permaculture is all about finding creative solutions to living a more sustainable life by growing local organic food, reducing energy consumption, recycling our waste and creating habitat for other life around us."

6:30 Potluck Supper (bring a dish to share and your own potluck kit - plate, bowl, cup, utensils, napkin)

7:00 Announcements and Movie

8:30-9:00-ish Discussion and Closing

Hope to see you there!

For those with allergies, please be aware there are cats in the house (who will probably hide upstairs for the evening!)

Â
item.how_to_find_us: The house is a brown cape with a large, white deck. You can get to it by either turning down Canal Rd. just after the Bar Mills bridge or by driving down Usher Mill Rd, since they connect up by the power station.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Buxton/Hollis/Gorham Movie Night: Permaculture and Organic Gardening
